entry.title: Revert "ash: make ScrollBarByDraggedDesk less flaky"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 314a74fc0c03c7de36aa28831f2d0b8c84acd0fa.



Reason for revert: Breaking multiple DesksTest.ContinueScrollBar* tests.



Original change's description:

> ash: make ScrollBarByDraggedDesk less flaky

>

> This CL addresses flakiness in the above test. The test verifies

> scrolling behavior in the desk bar by dragging a desk over the bar's

> scroll buttons. The scroll buttons have a built-in one second timer, and

> the test tries to time things according to this. This makes the test

> quite flaky.

>

> I've made a few changes to the test, and one to the code under test:

>

> * ScrollArrowButton has been changed so that it pays attention to

> ScopedAnimationDurationScaleMode instead of being locked to 1s.

> This means we can reduce our waits in the test.

>

> * The test no longer tries to verify intermediate steps of scrolling.

> It waits long enough for the desk bar to scroll completely to the end

> or beginning.

>

> * The test was previously saving a copy of `desks_bar->mini_views()`

> and indexing into it. This makes things harder to understand since

> the desk bar will reorder mini views in the desk bar. The test is

> now just getting the current state of the mini views whenever it

> needs to.

>

> BUG=b:300012605

>

> Change-Id: I313b7db9afb35541983c82a91afd41099464bff1

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4909698

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Andersson

> Commit-Queue: Daniel Andersson

> Reviewed-by: Yongshun Liu

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1205499}



BUG=b:300012605, chromium:1489530

No-Presubmit: true

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true



Change-Id: Ibd5bfc5a6d0023ed54706c38125ad5fff41ad2e4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4914298

Bot-Commit: Rubber Stamper

Commit-Queue: Eriko Kurimoto

Auto-Submit: Eriko Kurimoto

Owners-Override: Eriko Kurimoto

Commit-Queue: Rubber Stamper

entry.content:
Some constructors ended with a `return this;` line. I'm not sure why

these were added originally. Constructors implicitly return `this`

anyways. My guess is we at some point had a weird way of constructing

the objects. But the code today works without these lines, so this CL

removes them.

entry.title: Refactor HlsDataSourceProvider and implementation
entry.content:
The HlsDataSourceProviderImpl / MultiBufferDataSource ownership model

was severely broken, as the MBDS instances were owned by

HlsDataSourceImpl instances, which were routinely passed in callbacks

and captured in closures where they weren't able to be aborted prior to

destruction. This refactor not only simplifies the structure of

HlsDataSourceProvider by removing two layers of class indirection, but

also ensures that HlsDataSourceProviderImpl always retains proper

ownership of MBDS instances in order to prevent the UAF caused by

freeing the provider impl during data source initialization and fetch

looping.



R=dalecurtis



Bug: 1478104

Change-Id: I52b0625bf717e8429e5cc943d166cebf45716c05

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4908824

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Commit-Queue: Ted (Chromium) Meyer

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1205611}

entry.content:
This mojo interface is used for checking BFCache state. Currently the

instance is initialized and passed around as an associated remote, which

which is the IndexedDBControl. There's no need to serialize calls

entry.title: [remoting] Set the RANDR Output's physical size in mm.
entry.content:
This updates DesktopResizerX11 to set some RANDR Output properties

when resizing a display. These properties are supported by the

xf86-video-dummy driver, and they affect the physical size of the

display which is reported in the X11 RRGetOutputInfo response. The

dimensions are calculated based on the resolution and DPI from the

ClientResolution request.



GNOME uses this information to select an appropriate scaling factor

(when automatic scaling is enabled, which is the default setting).



Before this CL, GNOME's automatic scaling always chooses 100%. Users

can disable automatic-scaling in GNOME by modifying the dconf registry

setting:

org.gnome.desktop.interface scaling-factor



Low-Coverage-Reason: HARD_TO_TEST X11 protocol code.

entry.title: [a11y] Normalize the Textfield's (Views) accessible value
entry.content:
Textfields from Blink expose the display text (what's rendered on the

screen) as the accessible value, and we do the same for all labels both

in Blink or in Views.



However, the Views' Textfield class was the only class exposing the raw

text as accessible value. This was forcing us to manually handle the

case where it's a password and we should be exposing "***" instead,

and was completely ignoring the eliding logic.



This CL fixes it by applying the display text value in the RenderText,

the same way we are doing it for labels too.



This will facilitate my CL:4852850 where we are computing the rendered

offsets of each grapheme.



Change-Id: I6b1b80193f40be41939e86e209ec2bb6c9d45237

entry.title: Hide Underlying page from Accessibility when in WebXR/VR
entry.content:
When we begin a Cardboard VR session as part of WebXR, the underlying

page is hidden. However, Accessibility tools still attempt to cycle

through this content. This can lead to confusion of users using these

tools. This fixes the issue by setting the "Content" element (which the

tab controls and actual Web Content are parented to) as Unimportant to

accessibility while we are in a VR session.

entry.title: [Clipboard] Write well-formed HTML to the clipboard using async API.
entry.content:
In this change we use the below algorithm to write a well-formed HTML document

to the clipboard using `write()` method:

1. Create a DOMParser using blink::DOMParser::Create.

2. Call DOMParsers parseFromString method to parse the html string provided

by the web authors.

3. Serialize the document returned from step 2.

4. Return the serialized html string from step 3.



Input to async write method:

"

html text

"



Explainer: https://github.com/w3c/editing/blob/gh-pages/docs/clipboard-unsanitized/explainer.md



Bug: 1268679

entry.title: Revert "Plumb Most Visited URL / Query type information from Top Sites."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 89de16222a9ef3dfeb1eba7076a7514907dbae55.



Reason for revert: Once repeatable query is identified, the SRP visit is recorded in TopSitesDatabase, which does not persist the relevant information.



Original change's description:

> Plumb Most Visited URL / Query type information from Top Sites.

>

> This change enables us to determine whether Most Visited site is a URL

> or Search based on the origin of the information, bypassing the cost

> of decomposing the URL and looking for a query.

entry.title: HDR images: Propagate headroom to gpu::raster::RasterDecoderImpl
entry.content:
HDR images have their tonemapping "baked in" during image decode.

This means that if the HDR headroom changes (which it does), we have

to re-decode the image. This also significantly complicates the

implementation of the dynamic-range-limit CSS property.



Fix this situation by having the tonemapping be applied at raster

time, on the service side.



In order to perform tonemapping, the RasterDecoder needs to know the

HDR headroom. Plumb that information through the following path:

- cc::TileManager::CreateRasterTask

- already has the parameter)

- cc::RasterSource::PlaybackSettings

- add new member)

- gpu::raster::RasterInterface::BeginRasterCHROMIUM

- (command buffer glue)

- gpu::raster::RasterDecoderImpl::DoBeginRasterCHROMIUM



In the next patch, this will be used to apply tonemapping on the

service side.



Add tests for the client side of the propagation. End-to-end testing

will require the tonemapping change (which will be in the next patch).



Bug: 1483235

entry.title: Move the SelectFileDialog::Listener out of VmApplicationsServiceProvider
entry.content:
Make a dedicated class to implement the SelectFileDialog::Listener,

instead of in VmApplicationsServiceProvider directly. Then the dedicated

class can call ListenerDestroyed() in its dtor to fulfill the

requirement from SelectFileDialog. The newly added class also helps

separate the core VmApplicationsServiceProvider responsibilities from

the file selection handling.

ParseSelectFileDialogFileTypes() to a static method.

entry.title: Cleanup print browser tests to only use parameter helper methods
entry.content:
Some print browser tests have been directly using GetParam() within the

main test logic to determine if a test is for platform API calls from

within the browser vs. out-of-process. This makes the tests more

difficult to maintain, since those lines would otherwise break if the

test suite parameters need to be adjusted.



Replace these GetParam() calls with the parameter helper method

UseService(). The boolean return value from UseService() is inverted

compared to the pre-existing checks for an kInBrowserProcess parameter.

Maintain positive logic by swapping the if and else blocks in these

cases.



This is a mechanical change with no effect on test behavior.

entry.title: Linux/Cros: Move SetThreadType off of RenderMessageFilter
entry.content:
Thread priorities cannot be correctly changed in any sandboxed process,

but currently this operation is only proxied out of renderers. This

moves SetThreadType off of RenderMessageFilter and into a separate

content::mojom::ThreadTypeSwitcher mojo interface so this interface can

be reused for other sandboxed processes, not just renderers.



The new content::mojom::ThreadTypeSwitcher is bound by

ChildProcessHost::BindHostReceiver() like many other per-process

interfaces are. The browser-side implementation runs directly on the

IO thread since all it does it dispatch the work to another thread.



RendererThreadTypeHandler (which proxies calls to

PlatformThread::SetCurrentThreadType out of the renderer process)

is renamed to SandboxedProcessThreadTypeHandler and moved to

content/child.



Change-Id: Id59c4ad0d4db2321dad994c702f6f2527aff5310

entry.title: [fedcm] Validate .well-known when it contains an accounts_endpoint.
entry.content:
In this CL, we expand the set of valid well-known files to include the

case where an accounts_endpoint is specified (as well as a signin_url)

and that matches the ones provided in the config file.



This allows multiple configURLs to be used, as long as they all share

the same accounts/signin endpoints, enabling IdPs to deploy more than

one endpoint configurations, while maintaining the privacy properties.



This functionality is developed behind a flag, while we get validation

from the privacy team that this isn't breaking any of the assumptions

we made so far.

entry.title: MB: Check for the existence of a GN args location json.
entry.content:
Builders that define their GN args in starlark will be found via one of

the files specified in the gn_args_locations_files field in

mb_config.pyl. The config file includes both prod and dev versions, but

when a branch project is set up on a branch, the dev version is deleted

by the starlark generation since we don't run dev versions of the branch

projects. This causes MB operations that look up the config for a

builder to fail once a branch has a LUCI project set up. This changes it

so that it first checks for the existence of the location file before

attempting to read it.

entry.title: [Settings][Code health] Centralize + reconcile settings-columned-section
entry.content:
Improve the recently centralized two-column description style,

reconcile it, apply it more widely to further pages that use a multi-

column description layout (for now multiple UIs that use the 2-colum

"When on"/"Things to consider" style), and rename it to settings-

columned-section.



1. Apply the style to more pages that defined their own variant of

this style so far: the speed page, the page content page, and the

adPrivacy>measurement page. Extract and reconcile some more of the

common parts of the style across those UIs and move them to the

central style file. This includes removal of the "two-column" class

across all surfaces, also from Privacy Guide itself, as declaring this

became superfluous from the style computing this automatically.



2. Fix minimal style inconsistencies among the page content page, the

adPrivacy>measurement page, and the speed page, including:

2A: Fix the indentation of the description of the speed page to match

the indentation of privacy guide, security page, page content page,

and adPrivacy>measurement page.

2B: Fix the margins of the description of the adPrivacy>measurement

and page content page to fit the rest of the pages.



3. Simplify the description list and list items code: make them |ul|

and |li| elements, instead of declaring |role="list"| and

|role="listitem"| (see comment in [1] for reference).



For easier reference, the UI of the affected pages stays (almost)

untouched (only if you know the UIs in detail you will spot that

details like the margins changed minimally):

- Speed page:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/96jtkpr7rZcbFpy

- Page content page:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5ngH8fxRjYXpQdd

- adPrivacy>measurement page:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3b8gX44j4u6GnNW

- PG card-with-toggle:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/fV3UwfvvYMLVXo2

- PG card-with-radios:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7h7HvFWkk5E3kWF



What is left open after this CL?

A) The security page and the preloading page should also be refactored

to use the centralized style instead of declaring their own variant of

it (see crbug.com/1487632), and should use the simpler |ul| and |li|

elements.

B) Privacy Guide itself could be refactored to stop using the

privacy_guide_list_item element, which could be removed altogether and

replaced by the corresponding simple style defined in the new

centralized style. We'll look into this and decide if this is the right

path forward for Privacy Guide.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4834359/comment/290f7087_7424c81b/



Bug: 1215630,1476887,1484278,1487632

entry.title: ash: make ScrollBarByDraggedDesk less flaky
entry.content:
This CL addresses flakiness in the above test. The test verifies

scrolling behavior in the desk bar by dragging a desk over the bar's

scroll buttons. The scroll buttons have a built-in one second timer, and

the test tries to time things according to this. This makes the test

quite flaky.



I've made a few changes to the test, and one to the code under test:



* ScrollArrowButton has been changed so that it pays attention to

ScopedAnimationDurationScaleMode instead of being locked to 1s.

This means we can reduce our waits in the test.



* The test no longer tries to verify intermediate steps of scrolling.

It waits long enough for the desk bar to scroll completely to the end

or beginning.



* The test was previously saving a copy of `desks_bar->mini_views()`

and indexing into it. This makes things harder to understand since

the desk bar will reorder mini views in the desk bar. The test is

now just getting the current state of the mini views whenever it

needs to.



BUG=b:300012605

entry.title: view-transition: Refactor InvokeDOMChangeCallback
entry.content:
This is a minor cleanup.



The DOMChangeCallback normally returns its result through the

DOMChangedFinishedCallback which fulfils promises and calls back into

ViewTransition.



However, if the callback doesn't exist or failed for some reason, this

method would manually fulfil the promises and callback into

ViewTransition by returning control back to the caller.



This CL removes the latter special path by treating these cases as a

no-op promise that resolves/rejects with an empty value or DOMException.

There should be no behavior difference.



Change-Id: I6b8a9d4de979879e221e367dce79425c27ab843e

entry.title: Remove record type CHECK() in re-auth checkout flow
entry.content:
This CHECK() should actually include full server cards as well, since

after a recent re-auth opt-in refactor it is possible for full server

cards to be opted-in to re-auth. Thus this resolves a possible crash in

the re-auth checkout flow. This possible crash was introduced in M119,

and we are still in the automatic merge back period, so this is fixable.



In addition to full server cards, we will soon add support for masked

server cards here. At this point it's better to just remove the check

now instead of later.

entry.title: [autopip] Observe tabstrips more efficiently
entry.content:
Currently, the AutoPictureInPictureTabHelper uses a

BrowserTabStripTracker to observe all tabstrip changes in order to know

when to trigger autopip. This CL makes some changes to make the

tabstrip observation more efficient:



1) It only observes the tabstrip when the tab has registered for

autopip or is currently in autopip



2) While this still uses a BrowserTabStripTracker in cases where the

tabstrip is unknown (e.g. while the tab is being dragged between

tabstrips), it will observe only the current tabstrip when it is known



3) The logic has been split out into a separate helper class for easier

testing and to keep the AutoPictureInPictureTabHelper logic simpler



Bug: 1465988

entry.title: [omnibox][ml][chrome://omnibox] Add `createEl()` helper (3/6)
entry.content:
There's a lot of places in the code that do:

1) Create an element via `let el = document.createElement(tag);`

2) Add classes to the element via `el.classList.add();

3) Set the text of the element via `el.textContent = '';`

4) Add the element to the do via `parentEl.appendChild(el);`



This CL adds a helper `createEl` to do 1-4 in 1 call:

`createCl(tag, parentEl, classes, text);`



Refactor only; no user behavior change.

entry.title: WebUI: Update @typescript-eslint/{eslint-plugin,parser} to v6.7.4.
entry.content:
This is a necessary preparatory step for updating TypeScript to v5.2 in

a follow-up CL.



The new version has moved the location of the main binary, from

node_modules/@typescript-eslint/parser to

node_modules/@typescript-eslint/parser/dist/index.js.



Updated to the new path in several .eslintrc.js files.



Moreover, with the newer version several new errors in

ash/webui/camera_app_ui/ had to be fixed/suppressed.

- Updated eslint-plugin-jsdoc from v37.5.1 to v46.8.2 to fix

internal errors when running ESLint.

- Replaced @typescript-eslint/sort-type-union-intersection-members

with @typescript-eslint/sort-type-constituents (rule was renamed).

- Removed jsdoc/newline-after-description rule (no longer exists)

- Moved @typescript-eslint/prefer-optional-chain as needed in the

.eslintrc.js file, since it now requires `parserOptions.project`

to be specified for it to work.

- Updated jsdoc/tag-lines rule definition, as needed to fix new

errors (default spec for that rule seem to has changed)

- Fixed newly found @typescript-eslint/prefer-nullish-coalescing

violation.



(Some ash/webui/camera_app_ui/ fixes provided by pihsun@)



Bug: 1488690,b/303328674

entry.title: Refactor GetPublisherUrl to eagerly recalculate
entry.content:
Previously, when PrimaryPageChanged fired we recalculated then pushed

the result up to Java. This approach is brittle since it relies on

PrimaryPageChanged triggering before Java is done updating the url,

which is not guaranteed. The cost of recalculating every time is small

and guarantees a result that's not stale.

entry.title: [Extensions UserScripts] Add glob support for user scripts
entry.content:
A registered user script is injected only when the URL:

- matches any "matches" pattern or any "includeGlobs" pattern, if

present

- and does not match "excludeMatches", if present

- and does not match "excludeGlobs" patterns, present.



This CL adds the "includeGlobs" and "excludeGlobs" parameters to

userScripts.register API, and hooks to the existent glob matching

functionality.



Note that the URL matching is different than the existent content

scripts. Thus, it also updates the User Scripts test to take into

account the URL matching according to their source.



Bug: 1385165
